ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I've learned many different acting methods and how to inhabit a character fully with inner objects and other wonderful tools.

This course furthered my understanding of both Restoration theater as well as a variety of acting techniques. It greatly increased my awareness of the world and people around me and taught me to find stories in everything.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course allows students to work with a variety of acting techniques as well as an assortment of texts. The course is quite successful in furthering students ability to recognize and tell stories. At times the course felt more like rehearsal than acting class, and I could focus less on students putting up scenes and more on developing the theory and technique behind acting that is grappled with early in the semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, acting is so much fun and helps you gain a better understanding of yourself and the world around you.

I would recommend this course to a student insofar as they are looking for opportunities to work with a variety of texts and mount a good number of scenes. This class grapples less with acting technique than other courses I've taken and feels at times more like a rehearsal space than an acting class.
yes, very fun interesting and engaging
